wikipedia_page.main:
Cuthbert Hilton Golding-Bird (1848–1939) was an English surgeon at Guy's Hospital, fellow of the Royal College of Surgeons, and lecturer to medical students.  He was skilled in histology, invented a dilator for use in tracheotomies, and pioneered a new gastroenterological surgical procedure.
Outside of medicine, Golding-Bird was known as a collector of clocks and publisher of books on local archaeology.

response: * July 7 – Cuthbert Hilton Golding-Bird (died 1939), English surgeon.
*Cuthbert Hilton Golding-Bird, notable surgeon, Meopham historian, and son of Golding Bird
* Cuthbert Hilton Golding-Bird (1848–1939), British surgeon, son of Golding Bird

Marrying Mary Ann Brett in 1842, Bird moved from his family home at Wilmington Square, Clerkenwell, to 19 Myddleton Square.  They had two daughters and three sons, the second of whom, Cuthbert Hilton Golding-Bird (1848–1939), became a notable surgeon.Payne and McConnell"Golding-Bird, Cuthbert Hilton (1848–1939)", Plarr's Lives of the Fellows Online, retrieved and archived 10 March 2012.  Another son, Percival Golding-Bird, became a priest in Rotherhithe,Beck, Edward Joselyn, Memorials to Serve for a History of the Parish of St. Mary, Rotherhithe, p. 90, Cambridge University Press, 1907
* Cuthbert Hilton Golding-Bird (1848–1939), British surgeon and son of Golding Bird
